faqs.question: Les étrangers peuvent-ils acheter un bien immobilier en Espagne ?
faqs.answer: Yes. Non-EU citizens and EU citizens have essentially identical property purchase rights in Spain. Foreigner ownership is protected constitutionally, requiring only an NIE (tax identification number) obtainable through the Spanish tax authority. No restrictions limit property value, location, or quantity of purchases. Legal protections equivalent to Spanish citizens apply. Specialist international property attorneys typically manage purchase transactions, ensuring compliance with Spanish conveyancing procedures and your jurisdictional requirements.

faqs.question: Quels sont les frais d'achat d'un bien immobilier en Espagne ?
faqs.answer: Purchase costs beyond the property price typically total 8-10% of the acquisition value. These include: transfer tax (6-10% depending on autonomous community), notary fees (€800-€1,500), property registry costs (€500-€1,000), and legal representation (€1,500-€3,000). Mortgage arrangement fees apply if financing. Post-purchase annual costs include property tax (0.4-1.1% of cadastral value), municipality fees, and optional private insurance. These costs remain substantially below equivalent UK property transactions.

faqs.question: Combien coûtent les taxes foncières en Espagne ?
faqs.answer: Annual property tax (IBI) averages 0.4-1.1% of the cadastral value (typically 50-70% of market value). For this €725,000 property, estimated annual IBI would be €1,200-€2,000. Additionally, residents pay municipal fees (basura tax, typically €150-€300 annually) and optional private insurance. Capital gains tax applies upon sale (19-45% depending on holding period), with significant exemptions for primary residence sales by individuals over 65. Overall annual holding costs remain modest compared to Northern European equivalents.

faqs.question: Puis-je obtenir un prêt hypothécaire en Espagne en tant qu'étranger ?
faqs.answer: Yes. Most Spanish banks offer mortgages to non-resident foreigners, typically requiring 30-40% deposit with loan terms up to 25 years. Interest rates for foreigners typically range 3.5-4.5% depending on credit profile and loan-to-value ratio. Documentation requirements include passport, income verification, and employment history. Specialist mortgage brokers familiar with non-resident requirements significantly simplify the process. Many foreigners secure financing through their home country banks, which sometimes offer competitive rates for offshore properties.

faqs.question: Quel est le coût de la vie sur la Costa Blanca ?
faqs.answer: Living costs remain 30-40% below Northern Europe. Monthly expenses for comfortable living typically include: €200-€300 groceries, €100-€150 utilities, €80-€120 internet/phone, €800-€1,200 dining out (2-3 occasions weekly). Healthcare insurance costs €1,200-€2,000 annually. Private school fees range €4,000-€8,000 annually. Fuel costs approximately €40-€50 monthly for local driving. Lifestyle flexibility enables spending adjustment from €1,500 (modest) to €4,000+ (upscale) monthly depending on preferences.

faqs.question: La Costa Blanca est-elle adaptée aux retraités ?
faqs.answer: Excellent. Costa Blanca attracts significant retiree populations due to favorable climate, affordable healthcare, low cost of living, and established English-speaking expatriate communities. Spanish residency via Non-Lucrative Visa requires minimal income (€1,260 monthly) and provides permanent residence rights. Healthcare quality exceeds many home countries at fraction of the cost. The social infrastructure, including clubs, activities, and volunteer opportunities, creates comprehensive community engagement. Property purchases offer retirees lifestyle enhancement with capital preservation or appreciation potential.

faqs.question: À quelle distance se trouve la Costa Blanca de la France ?
faqs.answer: Approximately 1,200 kilometers (750 miles) as the crow flies. Flight time from UK airports to Alicante averages 2.5 hours direct, with multiple daily connections on low-cost carriers (Ryanair, Easyjet) at typical fares of €30-€80 return. Seasonal variations offer substantial savings during shoulder periods. Rail connections from UK via France require 24-30 hours. The accessibility makes Costa Blanca ideal for UK expatriates maintaining family connections through frequent visits or dual residency arrangements.

faqs.question: Quel temps fait-il sur la Costa Blanca ?
faqs.answer: Mediterranean climate delivers 300+ days annual sunshine with average temperatures of 18°C (65°F). Summer (June-September) features consistent warm weather (28-32°C/82-90°F) with minimal rainfall. Winter (December-February) remains mild (12-17°C/54-63°F) with occasional rainy days. Spring and autumn provide ideal conditions (20-25°C/68-77°F). The elevated Polop position (400 meters) provides natural cooling compared to coastal areas. UV protection and sun exposure management remain advisable. The climate supports year-round outdoor activities without seasonal extremes.
